ASTLEY HALL (2)
The collections of paintings and pottery at the hall are of exceptional interest. There is also an art gallery where exhibitions by local artists are reguarly held The drawing room has been refurbished as a period room displaying early 18th. Century furniture. Astley Hall is situated in Astley Park and is named after the Astley family, one of the early owners of the Hall and vast gardens. It is rumered that underground passageways once existed linking the Hall to St.Lawrence's Church (the Parish Church) and a building which is now the Yarrow Bridge Hotel on Bolton Road on the South side of Chorley.
